snippet: The British Medical Journal will no longer publish the results of clinical trials unless drug companies agree to provide detailed study data on request.
abstract: British Medical Journal says beginning January 2013 it will no longer publish results of clinical trials unless drug companies and researchers agree to provide detailed study data on request; pharmaceutical companies often publish results that showcase their drugs in best possible light, withholding data that would allow for independent verification.
lead_paragraph: The British Medical Journal will no longer publish the results of clinical trials unless drug companies agree to provide detailed study data on request.

headline.seo: British Medical Journal to Require Detailed Clinical Trial Data
headline.main: Medical Journal to Require More Details on Drug Trials
